H6726.def: = mountain; ► that part of {L:Jerusalem<SDBH:יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם>} on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, YHWH's dwelling place

H2814.def: = action by which humans or deities refrain from speaking, expressing themselves, or acting in response

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H8252.def: = state in which an inanimate object does not move

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H6664.def: = state in which a weight or measure is correct or accurate, in accordance with a standard

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H5051.def: = process by which an object gives out or reflects a bright light

H3444.def: = causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue or protection (of humans in need) implying success

H1197.def: = process by which someone or something is harmed or destroyed by fire

H3940.def: = piece of wood burning on one end; ► used to provide light or as a means of igniting something else; ≈ associated with light and destruction

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H6664.def: = state in which a weight or measure is correct or accurate, in accordance with a standard

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H3519.def: = position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H2319.def: = state in which an object has been in existence for only a short time ◄ because of having recently been built or produced

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H5344.def: = causative action by which humans use a sharp object to make a hole through an object

H5850.def: = circular or semi-circular ornamental headdress, ◄ usually made out of precious metals and decorated with jewels, ► worn by kings, priests, and officials as a symbol of authority and status; also given to women by their suitors to win their affection

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H4410.def: = state in which a person or deity has been entrusted with the office of {L:king<SDBH:מֶלֶךְ>} or {L:queen<SDBH:מַלְכָּה>}

H3709.def: = the inner part of the human {L:hand<SDBH:יָד>}, but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H5800.def: = action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H2657.def: = woman; ► wife of king {L:Hezekiah<SDBH:חִזְקִיָּהוּ>}; mother of king {L:Manasseh<SDBH:מְנַשֶּׁה>}

H1166.def: = action by which someone exercises authority over other people

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H2654.def: = state in which humans and deities are emotionally attached to (other) humans

H970.def: = a young, fully grown, unmarried male ► associated with joy and strength

H1166.def: = action by which someone exercises authority over other people

H1330.def: = young unmarried woman, who has never been married before, and has never had sex with a man

H2860.def: = man who is about to be married or has just been married; ≈ often associated with joy

H4885.def: poetic term; = state in which humans, deities, and animals feel and show great joy

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H7797.def: poetic term; = state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy

H2346.def: = structure surrounding a building, a collection of buildings, or a town; ◄ made out of stone; ► provides protection; ≈ associated with strength, safety, and the ability to resist attacks from outside

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H6485.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe a person, group, or object ► with the purpose of determining their well-being, condition, and/or integrity

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H2814.def: = action by which humans or deities refrain from speaking, expressing themselves, or acting in response

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H3915.def: = the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H3559.def: = state in which an object is firmly and immovably located in a certain place

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H8416.def: = action by which humans express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to deities about who they are and what they do

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H7650.def: = action by which humans or deities make a solemn statement often calling on a higher power to confirm that what is said is true or to punish the speaker if it turns out not to be true

H3225.def: = the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun

H5797.def: = state in which an object is able to withstand force

H2220.def: = each of the two upper limbs of the body, including the shoulder and extending until the hand; ≈  directly associated with strength and power

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H1715.def: = seeds of cultivated cereal; ► used as food

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H3978.def: = any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink ► in order to maintain life and growth

H5236.def: = state in which something is associated with a nation or country that is different from one's own

H8492.def: = dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of newly harvested grapes and possibly still at the beginning of the fermentation process; ► used as beverage and for sacrifice; ≈ represents the entire range of agricultural products in Israel, together with grain and oil; associated with joy and well-being, and only once with drunkenness and foolishness{N:001}

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H3021.def: = action by which humans are engaged in laborious activity which requires a lot of energy and ultimately results in exhaustion

H622.def: = process by which humans come together from different places and form a group for a common purpose, such as for a meeting or for war

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H1984.def: = process by which an object emits or reflects light; ≈ regarded as awesome

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6908.def: = action by which humans or animals come together as a group for a common purpose

H6944.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H2691.def: = collection of dwellings, not surrounded by a wall

H6437.def: = action by which humans or animals turn their body to face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H5549.def: literally: to make high; hence: = causative action by which humans create a road or access ramp by covering the surface of the ground with thicks layers of sand

H4546.def: = a relatively wide road or access ramp made by by covering the surface of the ground with thicks layers of sand

H5619.def: = causative action by which humans throw stones at other humans

H68.def: = hard, heavy, and strong substance, ◄ very commonly found in nature,  ► which can be hewn into different shapes by a craftsman

H5251.def: = a distinctive object in the form of a flag or board attached to a stick, or a metal device or image fitted on the end of a pole; ► normally used to identify a particular group, or as a rallying point for soldiers in war; ≈ often used figuratively to denote an example, or a person or deity that one can rely on, or something that shows the way

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H1323.def: = direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

H3468.def: = a state in which a human or deity helps a human in need to be safe / a safe state

H7939.def: = a fixed regular payment for work, either with money or in kind; ≈ by extension: all that happens in return for one's actions

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H6468.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H6944.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H1875.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H5800.def: = action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place
